channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TX
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TX

item.title: Report X-2024070944
item.description:
Report X-2024070944

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-15T18:15:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-12
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package was found in Hazmat cage on a cart sitting in a tote wrapped in plastic bags. Black paint was all over the outside of the box. All 4 one gallon metal paint cans inside were soiled by black paint. The lid was off of one of the cans. Attached is the FTRACK main page and additional info page showing that no code 96 was applied and commodity information is not in system. Flammable liquid hazard diamond and UN1263 paint were seen on outer box.

item.description:
Report E-2024070239

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-13
  • City: ROBINSON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that 48-ounces of UN 1987, Leather dye released from a carton containing 12 bottles due to being crushed under heavier cargo during transit. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and he felt confident cleaning the spill with absorbents and containerizing the waste into a 5-gallon poly drum for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024070764
item.description:
Report X-2024070764

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-12T15:12:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-10
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package was found wet near a load door. Shipping label was only half legible. Tracking number or barcode were not visible. Tracking number was found matching the package to SPIDR images. Box, shipper, recipient and weight were matched to package with images. 2 bottles of chlorinating liquid were inside the box. 1 was crushed and half empty. Both were soiled. No hazard diamonds or markings were seen on outer box.

item.description:
Report X-2024070583

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-08

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0

item.title: Report X-2024070575
item.description:
Report X-2024070575

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-11T18:15:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-08
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package was found on a cart next to the conveyor belt coming from unload. Box was ripped wide open and had wet spots. Upon inspection, all 4 of the 5 liter plastic bottles were full and no active leakage was found. However, 2 of the bottles were lightly soiled and had small drops of moisture on the outside, which tested as a pH 10-12, the same as the liquid inside. This suggests that prior leakage, although minor, occured.

item.title: Report X-2024070617

  • Description: Appears too much weight was placed on the package which caused the (4) 1-Gal Plastic bottles to compress. This compression caused the liquid Xylene to be expressed out through the cap. QA was notified, package was removed inside of red plastic tote utilizing all appropriate PPE (i.e. gloves, mask and goggles) to Hazmat cage for further processing.
